definition: to reward with food and drink/to feast (sb)/presents of food etc made to troops/Taiwan pr. [kao4 lao4]
to reward or comfort with presents of food, drink etc
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Of course, proximity to great vegan restaurants was a bonus.
sentences.chinese: 有时往一家好的素食餐馆大吃一顿犒劳自己。

sentences.english: For a treat, I like to feast on wild honey and bees.
sentences.chinese: 要是想犒劳一下自己，我喜欢享用野蜂蜜和蜜蜂。

sentences.english: Treat yourself to a massage or spa day.
sentences.chinese: 去做做推拿或者泡泡温泉，犒劳一下自己。

sentences.english: If time permits, save the fee of bus ticket as reward of your walk.
sentences.chinese: 如果有时间，把回家的车费当作步行的犒劳。

sentences.english: What I could reward myself today, is to forgive for what he did yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 今天要犒劳自己的是，原谅他昨天的过错。

sentences.english: You have your own money now. And you certainly deserve it.
sentences.chinese: 你自己挣了钱，当然应该好好犒劳自己。

sentences.english: They often want to treat themselves after a hard workout or race.
sentences.chinese: 在艰苦的健身或者比赛后他们经常想犒劳自己。

sentences.english: Maybe even treat yourself to a glass of strawberry-flavored milk.
sentences.chinese: 或许你甚至可以喝一杯草莓味牛奶，犒劳一下自己。

sentences.english: You can indulge yourself without spending a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 你不必花大把钱就可以好好犒劳一下自己。

sentences.english: They know he can’t pay them from beyond the grave.
sentences.chinese: 他们清楚地知道阴间的君主是不可能犒劳他们的。

sentences.english: Maybe it's time to re-think our definition of a "treat."
sentences.chinese: 可能是需要重新想想“犒劳”的含义了。

definition: to show appreciation (by kind words, small gifts etc)/to comfort
to eat one's fill/to be full
to eat and drink as much as one likes/to make a pig of oneself
to have a large and sumptuous meal (traditionally on the 1st and 15th of each month)
